section.title: Example: Microsoft Windows image
section.para: This example creates a Windows Server 2012 qcow2 image, using virt-install and the KVM hypervisor.

step.para: Follow this steps to prepare the installation:
Download a Windows Server 2012 installation ISO. Evaluation images are available on the Microsoft website (registration required).
Download the signed VirtIO drivers ISO from the Fedora website.
Start the Windows Server 2012 installation with the virt-install command:

screen.userinput: virt-install --connect qemu:///system \ --name ws2012 --ram 2048 --vcpus 2 \ --network network=default,model=virtio \ --disk path=ws2012.qcow2,device=disk,bus=virtio \ --cdrom /path/to/en_windows_server_2012_x64_dvd.iso \ --disk path=/path/to/virtio-win-0.1-XX.iso,device=cdrom \ --vnc --os-type windows --os-variant win2k8

step.para: Use virt-manager or virt-viewer to connect to the VM and start the Windows installation.

The disk is not detected by default by the Windows installer. When requested to choose an installation target, click Load driver and browse the file system to select the E:\WIN8\AMD64 folder. The Windows installer displays a list of drivers to install. Select the VirtIO SCSI and network drivers, and continue the installation.
Once the installation is completed, the VM restarts. Define a password for the administrator when prompted.

step.para: When the installation is done, in the Complete the Cloudbase-Init Setup Wizard window, select the Run Sysprep and Shutdown check boxes and click Finish.

section.para: Your image is ready to upload to the Image Service:

screen.userinput: glance image-create --name WS2012 --disk-format qcow2 \ --container-format bare --is-public \ --file ws2012.qcow2
